chunk: Tuna dip recipe A simple but yummy dip for your baby to enjoy as a snack. Age: 12 months and older Prep: 15 mins Cook: None Portions: 4 (approx) Ingredients - 160g tinned tuna in spring water, drained - 1 tbsp mayonnaise - 2 tsp plain full-fat yoghurt - 35g wholemeal pitta bread, cut into thin slices Method Put the tuna into a bowl, mash with the mayonnaise and yoghurt to make a paste. Serve with pitta bread fingers. Any leftovers can be covered and stored in the fridge. Information: Try offering it with vegetable sticks such as cucumber or carrots, as an alternative to pitta bread. Weaning tip From 12 months, your child should be having 3 meals a day. They may also need 2 healthy snacks in between.
title: Tuna Dip
description: A simple but yummy dip for your baby to enjoy as a snack.
ingredients: 160g tinned tuna in spring water, drained
35g wholemeal pitta bread, cut into thin slices
